definition: to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)

sentences.english: Sensual massage and foot rub are great way to help relax her body.
sentences.chinese: 撩人地推拿和足底按摩是幫助她放鬆身體的好方法。

sentences.english: She was standing very close to me, so close that the perfume from her hair was tantalizing.
sentences.chinese: 她站得離我很近，頭髮上的香氣撩人心魄。

sentences.english: The cheer captain in my school is too hot to handle.
sentences.chinese: 我們學校的啦啦隊長真是太性感撩人了。

sentences.english: She was standing very close to me, so close that the perfume from her hair was tantalizing6.
sentences.chinese: 她站得離我很近，頭髮上的香氣撩人心魄。

sentences.english: Dive into the sultry fragrance of the flowers growing deep in the age-old forest.
sentences.chinese: 潛入撩人的芬芳的花朵生長在古老的森林深處。

sentences.english: The girls are washing the goddess: she has her foot balanced, in a pose that is ever so slightly undignified, on the edge of the fountain.
sentences.chinese: 女神把腳搭在噴泉邊的臺子上，姿勢極其撩人。

sentences.english: This scene so fascinates me! Here before me is Baihua Pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 這景色撩人慾醉，不覺來到百花亭。

sentences.english: That dress is too provocative to wear to a job interview.
sentences.chinese: 那件衣服對於一個面試來說有點撩人。

sentences.english: Hong Kong certainly has excellent Chinese cuisine and shopping malls.
sentences.chinese: 香港當然有咱中國最撩人饞嘴的美食和大型購物商場。

sentences.english: I am so enchanted by the beautiful scenery and unconsciously arriving at the garden gloriette.
sentences.chinese: 這景色撩人，令人陶醉，不覺來到百花廳。

definition: ecstasy/rapture/to feel overwhelming joy or sorrow
